raw: waterfalls along the pipiwai trail kpahulu section haleakal national park at times the trail passed through wild k sugarcane and other agricultural plants at times it passed through alien invasive species such as bamboo and at times it passed through little bits of native vegetation. most of all i walked through and into like one hundred spider webs! i was constantly covered in webbingand sometimes a few spiders too.

closing in on 800 feet elevation. pipiwai trail kpahulu section haleakal national park finally after passing through lots of diverse vegetation and spider webs too the big pay off was the view at the end of the 400 ft. high waimoku falls. i complained in an earlier post about how underwhelming mnoa falls is compared to the waterfalls i know back home in upstate new york. it reminded me even a bit of yosemite falls in california although on a much smaller scale.

closing in on 800 feet elevation. pipiwai trail kpahulu section haleakal national park finally after passing through lots of diverse vegetation and spider webs too the big pay off was the view at the end of the 400 ft. high waimoku falls. i complained in an earlier post about how underwhelming mnoa falls is compared to the waterfalls i know back home in upstate new york. well waimoku falls is not underwhelming!

closing in on 800 feet elevation. pipiwai trail kpahulu section haleakal national park finally after passing through lots of diverse vegetation and spider webs too the big pay off was the view at the end of the 400 ft. high waimoku falls. i complained in an earlier post about how underwhelming mnoa falls is compared to the waterfalls i know back home in upstate new york. it reminded me even a bit of yosemite falls in california although on a much smaller scale.

waimoku falls ke ahupuaa o kpahulu after my hike it was off to spend the rest of the daymy last full day herein ke ahupuaa o hna the district of hna . the town of hna itself is sort of the center of east maui if you can call a town of 2 000 people a center. so i just poked around outside and took a few photographs.

waimoku falls ke ahupuaa o kpahulu after my hike it was off to spend the rest of the daymy last full day herein ke ahupuaa o hna the district of hna . the town of hna itself is sort of the center of east maui if you can call a town of 2 000 people a center. here is where you can get food groceries gasoline everything one needs from the capitalist trans local economy.

waimoku falls ke ahupuaa o kpahulu after my hike it was off to spend the rest of the daymy last full day herein ke ahupuaa o hna the district of hna . here is where you can get food groceries gasoline everything one needs from the capitalist trans local economy. hna has one museum the hana cultural center.

the hana cultural center on the grounds of the cultural center are a few interesting historic structures a courthouse that from 1871 to 1978 served all of east maui and a jail that from 1871 to 1997 did the same! it is rare for nineteenth century wooden structures to survive but it seems that what preserved these buildings for so long was their functionality. for over one hundred years rural east maui residents relied on these buildings to provide law and order.

inside wananalua church hna that's about it. i actually spent about six to seven hours just chillin' in hna town. i like wandering.

inside wananalua church hna that's about it. i actually spent about six to seven hours just chillin' in hna town. i got a plate lunch from a food truck got an ono popsicle from another vendor got snacks twice from two different grocery stories.

i got a plate lunch from a food truck got an ono popsicle from another vendor got snacks twice from two different grocery stories. i walked many of the town's streets and i spent a good few hours down at hna bay swimming reading writing and just passing the day. i really liked hanging in hna town and it reminded me of when i lived in catskill new york population approx.
hna bay wandering around hna bay i happened upon a small monument that was not mentioned in any of the guidebooks. it really was off the beaten path. here it is

a hidden monument here was born kaahumanu wife of kamehameha?
a hidden monument here was born kaahumanu wife of kamehameha?
a hidden monument here was born kaahumanu wife of kamehameha?

the monument is on an unmarked trail on the edge of hna bay the monument reads historical landmark territory of hawaii birthplace of kaahumanu who was born in 1768 and died in 1832 favorite wife of kamehameha i kuhina nui 1819 1832 queen regent 1825 1832 tablet erected 1928 by superintendent of public works. i wonder what in 1928 possessed the territorial government hawaii was ruled as a u. s. territory from 1900 to 1959 to erect this marker. till next time.
high and low on maui part iv for earlier posts in this maui travelogue please see part i part ii and part iii. here's part four.

the monument is on an unmarked trail on the edge of hna bay the monument reads historical landmark territory of hawaii birthplace of kaahumanu who was born in 1768 and died in 1832 favorite wife of kamehameha i kuhina nui 1819 1832 queen regent 1825 1832 tablet erected 1928 by superintendent of public works. i wonder what in 1928 possessed the territorial government hawaii was ruled as a u. s. territory from 1900 to 1959 to erect this marker. and how accurate is the historical marker?
high and low on maui part iv for earlier posts in this maui travelogue please see part i part ii and part iii. here's part four.

the monument is on an unmarked trail on the edge of hna bay the monument reads historical landmark territory of hawaii birthplace of kaahumanu who was born in 1768 and died in 1832 favorite wife of kamehameha i kuhina nui 1819 1832 queen regent 1825 1832 tablet erected 1928 by superintendent of public works. anyway it's an interesting document in the public history of these islands. evidently in the 1920s the territorial government had an interest in promoting a greater understanding of native hawaiian history.
high and low on maui part iv for earlier posts in this maui travelogue please see part i part ii and part iii. here's part four.

scientific spectacles attracted widespread public interest at commercial pleasure gardens amp public spaces in the new republic. in 1793 hundreds of spectators amp several founding fathers had watched the first man fly free over the new republic. new york city commercial pleasure garden entrepeneur frenchman joseph corr invited richard crosby to launch his beautiful varnished silk balloon and aeronautic carriage from his garden named mount vernon in 1800. for two weeks before the launching crosby lectured on the science of aerostation and invited the public to see the curious process of filling the balloon with inflammable air at mount vernon gardens.

the promotion worked. numerous patrons flocked to the site and a new york city newspaper assigned a reporter. last monday about 4 o'clock in the afternoon a beautiful balloon. was launched from mount vernon gardens. the wind being light at n. it rose about 400 feet almost perpendicular then took a southerly course and moved magnificently grand through the atmosphere till it was fairly out of sight.

scientific spectacles attracted widespread public interest at commercial pleasure gardens amp public spaces in the new republic. in 1793 hundreds of spectators amp several founding fathers had watched the first man fly free over the new republic. frenchman jean pierre blanchard rose in a hot air balloon over the rooftops of philadelphia then the nation's capital.

the promotion worked. numerous patrons flocked to the site and a new york city newspaper assigned a reporter. last monday about 4 o'clock in the afternoon a beautiful balloon. was launched from mount vernon gardens. the wind being light at n. it rose about 400 feet almost perpendicular then took a southerly course and moved magnificently grand through the atmosphere till it was fairly out of sight.

frenchman jean pierre blanchard rose in a hot air balloon over the rooftops of philadelphia then the nation's capital. from that point on regular balloon flights brought crowds of several thousand onlookers whenever take offs were expected and balloonomania swept right across the country. new york city commercial pleasure garden entrepeneur frenchman joseph corr invited richard crosby to launch his beautiful varnished silk balloon and aeronautic carriage from his garden named mount vernon in 1800. for two weeks before the launching crosby lectured on the science of aerostation and invited the public to see the curious process of filling the balloon with inflammable air at mount vernon gardens.

the promotion worked. numerous patrons flocked to the site and a new york city newspaper assigned a reporter. last monday about 4 o'clock in the afternoon a beautiful balloon. was launched from mount vernon gardens. the wind being light at n. it rose about 400 feet almost perpendicular then took a southerly course and moved magnificently grand through the atmosphere till it was fairly out of sight.

1783 joseph amp tienne montgolfier's hot air balloon in 1793 several founding fathers had watched the first man fly in a balloon over the new republic. thirty four year old frenchman jean pierre blanchard rose in an untethered hot air balloon from the courtyard of the prison in philadelphia then the nation's capital. many watched the balloon from their upper story windows in philadelphia.

1783 joseph amp tienne montgolfier's hot air balloon in 1793 several founding fathers had watched the first man fly in a balloon over the new republic. thirty four year old frenchman jean pierre blanchard rose in an untethered hot air balloon from the courtyard of the prison in philadelphia then the nation's capital. blanchard sold tickets to view the ascent for 2 5 each but most chose to watch outside the confines of the prison grounds.

statue of liberty. tripadvisor photo the statue of liberty is a centennial celebration gift to the united states from the french people. new york public library

statue of liberty. tripadvisor photo the statue of liberty is a centennial celebration gift to the united states from the french people. conceived by edouard de laboulaye sculpted by auguste bartholdi and structurally engineered by alexandre gustave eiffel.

conceived by edouard de laboulaye sculpted by auguste bartholdi and structurally engineered by alexandre gustave eiffel. the statue was constructed in paris then disassembled and shipped to america where she was reassembled and placed upon the pedestal designed by american architect richard morris hunt and engineered by general charles stone. she was the tallest structure in new york in 1886. the statue of liberty holds carries and wears symbols signifying freedom and democracy.

postsecret work postsecret is an art project in which people anonymously mail postcards with secrets written on them. some of the secrets are super funny. this exhibit was composed of six video screens cycling through various postcards.

one way trip to mars offered by dutch company

an artist's rendering of the mars one colony and astronauts on the red planet. bryan versteeg mars one by ben waldron mar. 28 2013 a dutch start up named mars one is hoping to send a select group of brave astronauts on a one way trip to the red planet in the year 2023 with the aim of establishing a permanent human colony.
one way trip to mars offered by dutch company

28 2013 a dutch start up named mars one is hoping to send a select group of brave astronauts on a one way trip to the red planet in the year 2023 with the aim of establishing a permanent human colony. founded in 2010 by 36 year old engineer bas lansdorp mars one says it has developed a road map and financing plan for the project and that the mission is perfectly feasible. it is both economically and logically feasible in motion through the integration of existing suppliers and experts in space exploration.
